title: Domaine de Beaupré 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This attractive fruity wine is just the ticket for summer food. It has weight and plenty of ripe red-berry fruits. It also has a crisper than usual edge that gives it a bright character. There are a touch of pepper and a final lift of acidity. Drink now.

title: Domenico 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Mild peach skin and apricot aromas precede fresh and vivid white peach flavors in this dry, refreshing wine. It's well balanced, has enough concentration to keep it interesting and will be very versatile with food.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: There's an inviting textural richness to this rounded silky Pinot Gris. White grapefruit and yellow-cherry flavors are sunny on the palate, accentuated by subtle hints of spice and nuts. Delicate tangerine acidity lifts the finish.

title: Lustau NV Amontillado Los Arcos Dry Sherry (Jerez)
description: This here is classic amontillado. Aromas of toffee, nuts and dried stone fruits set up a round, racy but regular palate. Salted caramel is key to a fresh traditional flavor profile, while bracing lively acidity creates length on a standard tasting finish.

title: Mt. Difficulty 2014 Roaring Meg Riesling (Central Otago)
description: At 20g/L of residual sugar, this is sweet enough to work well with spicy dishes, like many curries. Green apple, peach and pineapple flavors show a fine balance of ripeness and acidity on the long, mouthwatering finish.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Bricks and Roses Rosé (Lodi)
description: Made in a deliberately trim and delicate style from Rhône grape varieties, this wine has a pleasant light pink-peach color and canteloupe aromas that lead to a crisp palate of light body and fresh, tart lemon and cranberry flavors.

title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Malbec du Clos Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is one of the entry-level wines from this producer. It shows the ripe, soft side of Malbec without compromising on the firm structure and mineral edge that is natural to the grape and the appellation. The wine is developing easily and quickly, with bold black fruits and acidity. Drink now.

title: Ottella 2014 Molceo Riserva  (Lugana)
description: Honeysuckle, exotic fruit and herbaceous notes carry over to the racy palate, where they're joined by grapefruit, pineapple and green melon flavors. An almond note closes the crisp finish.

title: Ottella 2016  Lugana
description: This wine's tropical fruit and fragrant white flower scents lift out of the glass while the lively palate doles out juicy white peach, green apple and grapefruit flavors. It has clean, crisp finish.

title: Paolo Calì 2016 Blues Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Orchard fruit, citrus and almond aromas follow through to the palate. Fresh acidity enlivens the yellow apple and nectarine flavors while a hint of Mediterranean herb closes the finish.

title: Icono 2013 Selección Red (Valencia)
description: Dark berry aromas, chocolate and grit define the nose on this blend of Syrah, Cabernet and Tempranillo. The palate feels ripe and fresh, but the tannins are hard and grabby. Black plum flavors are bold and offer notes of spice, herbs and earthiness. This is composed on the finish despite a reprise of hard smacking tannins.

title: Jäger 2016 Steinriegl Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)
description: A touch of reduction on the nose shows how very young this wine still is. All it needs is a little more bottle age and some air to breathe to reveal its zesty lemon, lime and tangerine fruit. It's light in body and very refreshing. Drink now–2018.

title: Nadler 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)
description: Russet pear peel and flesh make for an inviting, appetizing nose. The palate is fresh and provides some yeasty, savory texture. There is ample freshness and lasting, yeasty spice. The finish is clean and very refreshing.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016  Greco di Tufo
description: Yellow stone fruit, citrus and Mediterranean brush aromas float out of the glass. On the bright, tangy palate, mature apricot and nectarine flavors mingle with savory mineral notes and hints of chopped herb.

title: Feudo Montoni 2014 Lagnusa Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with ripe red plum, blue flower and baking spice aromas. The juicy palate delivers ripe blackberry, star anise and white pepper notes, alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Fidelitas 2014 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Coming from one of the state's premier vineyards, barrel-spice aromas are at the fore on first pour, with black-fruit and herb notes far in the background. The dark-fruit flavors are concentrated initially, tapering slightly toward the finish.

title: Fidelitas 2014 Malbec (Red Mountain)
description: A blend of Scooteney Flats and Kiona vineyards, this 100% varietal wine initially brings barrel-forward aromas of vanillin, clove and spice. This evolves over time to reveal dark plum and pepper. The fruit flavors are fleshy yet still show restraint. If the barrel notes integrate, it could move up a notch.

title: Le Morette 2012 Riserva  (Lugana)
description: Ripe apple, toast and grilled herb scents lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers pear, ripe citrus and toasted almond hints. A mineral note lifts the finish.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Blended with 20% Grenache, this wine displays somewhat reticent aromas of cranberry, baking spice, raspberry and plum. The cherry flavors are rich with the tannins initially showing a touch of astringency that softens over time.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Château Gabriel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a blend of Grenache and Cinsault from the organic vineyard of Château Gabriel. It is a lively, crisp wine with fine acidity and refreshing red-currant fruits. It is bone dry, packed with bright acidity as well as fruitiness. Drink now.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Les Quatre Tours 2016 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a deliciously fruity wine. It has fine red-currant and citrus fruits that give it a fresh crisp texture and flavor. The attractive wine is so bright with fruit right up front. Drink now.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a blend of Syrah and Cinsault. That gives the wine structure as well as bright fruits. It is an elegant fruity wine with a creamy ripe texture along with red-currant and raspberry fruits. Drink the wine now.

title: Meinklang 2016 Burgenlandweiß White (Burgenland)
description: A lovely, fragrant lift of honeysuckle and grape rises from the glass in this wine. The palate is light and dry—still floral yet tinged with lemony freshness. Easy and bright like a summer breeze.

title: O-Neh-Da 2015 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Spring blossoms and lime zest scent this bristling light-footed Riesling. It's dryish on the palate and penetrates with crisp-tart peach and apricot flavors. The finish is invigoratingly mineral. Drink now through 2020.

title: Rainoldi 2011 Sassella  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This 100% Nebbiolo opens with classic varietal aromas of dried rose petal, underbrush and balsam. The savory palate delivers red raspberry, sour cherry and baking spice flavors, with polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink now–2021.

title: Pemartín NV Fino Palomino (Jerez)
description: Mild aromas of butter, hay and sea water feed into a crisp fresh palate that's punchy and solid. Lightly salted briny white-fruit flavors are classic for a fino, while this offers hints of vanilla and white pepper on the back end.

title: Robert Renzoni 2013 Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)
description: This grape excels in the region's warmer climate, proving relatively light in color and full of baked strawberry, caramel and dust aromas in this bottling. The palate is similarly light but carries an array of fun and easygoing flavors, including more red fruit and leather.

title: Seven Angels 2014 Unorthodox White (Central Coast)
description: This white Rhône blend places Grenache Blanc at center stage, with Marsanne, Picpoul Blanc and Viognier playing supporting roles. It's fresh and engaging on the nose, suggesting caramelized pear, apple blossom and chalk. Laser-sharp acidity and chalky minerality balance bold lime custard and apple skin flavors.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The year 2014 was a fine vintage for reserve-level wines, and this one brings concentrated cherry-berry fruit into a generous midpalate. Those big forward fruit flavors wrap through the finish, which is lightly touched, though not seriously impacted, with a glue-like note.

title: The Big Easy 2014 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose of this New Orleans-inspired blend is juicy and fruit forward, with blackberry jam, black plum and a light licorice scents. It's soft and full on the palate, with Concord grape flavors and nicely polished tannins. A crowd-pleaser.
